summary: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, known as ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease, is a rare and ultimately fatal neurological disorder. Not much is known about how to treat or prevent ALS. We reviewed certain federal funding to advance research on ALS and similar diseases and found: The National Institutes of Health and FDA awarded about $276 million from FY 2022-FY 2025 for research and treatment development Some...
title: Rare Diseases: Funding for Rare Neurodegenerative Disease Research and Access to ALS Investigational Drugs
